data.title: Eurovision 2008 – final results
data.meta_description: The finalists were: the big four France, Germany, Spain and the United Kingdom the host country Serbia the top nine countries from the first semi-final plus one wildcard from the juries the top nine countries from the second semi-final plus one wildcard from the juries The final was held on 24 May 2008 and was
data.meta_site_name: oneurope.co.uk - Eurovision news, reviews, podcasts and more
data.text:
The Grand Final of the Eurovision Song Contest 2024 took place in Sweden at the Malmö Arena on Saturday 11 May with Semi-Finals on Tuesday 7 and Thursday 9 May.

Swedish broadcaster SVT, together with the European Broadcasting Union (EBU), organised the Contest thanks to Loreen’s win in Liverpool in 2023.

It was the third time that Malmö had hosted the Eurovision Song Contest following 1992 and 2013 editions and the first time the Eurovision Song Contest hadn’t visited a capital city for five consecutive Contests.

Sweden itself hosted the Eurovision Song Contest for the 7th time in 2024 having previously also staged the competition in Stockholm in 1975, 2000 and 2016, in Gothenburg in 1985, and those Contests in Malmö.
